newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy's Telepiu looks for Spanish digital TV deal.
newsitem.headline: Italy's Telepiu looks for Spanish digital TV deal.

text.p: Italian-based pay-TV company Telepiu said on Wednesday it was working towards an alliance on digital TV in Spain, and had made contact with Spanish telecommunications company Telefonica.

Telepiu's chairman Jan Mojto said while attending the annual Venice Film Festival that the group "is working for the opening of the digital market in Spain and had made contracts with Telefonica". He gave no other details.

German media group Kirch and Nethold, controlled by the South African Rupert family, each control 45 percent of Telepiu with the remaining ten percent held by Fininvest SpA, the media group of former Italian prime minister Silvio Berlusconi.
